meanings.definition: The act of confronting or challenging someone directly.
meanings.sent1: His bearding of the bully showed his bravery.
meanings.sent2: The bearding of the opponent led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The bearding of the teacher with questions made the class laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her bearding of authority figures was like a lioness protecting her cubs.
meanings.sent5: The bearding of the dragon was a moment of courage in the story.

meanings.definition: The act of decorating or adorning with a beard.
meanings.sent1: The bearding of the statue made it look more regal.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed bearding his costume for the play.
meanings.sent3: The bearding of the Christmas tree with lights was a festive sight.
meanings.sent4: Her bearding of the cake with frosting was a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The bearding of the king's portrait added a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: The act of covering or surrounding something like a beard.
meanings.sent1: The bearding of fog around the mountain created a mystical scene.
meanings.sent2: The bearding of vines on the old house gave it a hidden look.
meanings.sent3: The bearding of the car with snow made it hard to recognize.
meanings.sent4: The bearding of the field with flowers was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The bearding of the city with lights transformed it into a wonderland.
